contentrichtext.text: {{About|the traffic intersection|the 1963 revue|Cambridge Footlights Revue}} [[Image:Cambridge Circus London.jpg|thumb|right|Cambridge Circus and the Palace Theatre]] '''Cambridge Circus''' is a traffic intersection (formerly a [[roundabout]]) at the intersection of [[Shaftesbury Avenue]] and [[Charing Cross Road]] in [[central London]].<ref name="telegraph" /> The junction is situated approximately halfway between [[Tottenham Court Road tube station]] (at [[St Giles Circus]]) and [[Leicester Square]]. The [[Palace Theatre, London|Palace Theatre]] is located on the west side of the junction.<ref name="telegraph" /> In his espionage novels, author [[John Le Carré]] placed the headquarters of the fictionalised British intelligence service based on [[MI6]] in buildings on Shaftesbury Avenue and Cambridge Circus;<ref name="telegraph">{{cite news| url=http://blogs.telegraph.co.uk/culture/christopherhowse/3646801/Exactly_where_is_the_Circus/ |author=Christopher Howse |publisher=''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'' |title=Exactly where is the Circus? |date=May 1, 2007}}</ref><ref name="le_carre">[[John Le Carré]] ''[[Call for the Dead]]''</ref> it is from this that Le Carré's nickname for MI6, "The Circus", derives. The BBC's [[Gordon Corera]] notes that the entrance described by Le Carré most closely resembles that of 90 Charing Cross Road, just north of Cambridge Circus.<ref name="bbc_circus"/> The actual MI6 has never occupied premises in or near Cambridge Circus.<ref name="bbc_circus"> {{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-14846154 |title=Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy: John Le Carre and reality |author=[[Gordon Corera]] |publisher=[[BBC News]] |date=11/09/2011 |accessdate=11/09/2011 }} </ref> <ref name="sis_buildings"> {{cite web |url=https://www.sis.gov.uk/our-history/buildings.html |title=Buildings |publisher=[[Secret Intelligence Service]] (MI6) |accessdate=11/09/2011 }} </ref> ==Film location== Cambridge Circus has featured as location in the following productions: *''[[The League of Gentlemen (film)|The League of Gentlemen]]'' 1960 *''[[Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy]]'' 1979 *''[[Match Point]]'' 2005 *''[[Slumdog Millionaire]]'' 2008 (featured as one of the questions) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/london/content/webcams/547551.shtml live traffic / street camera of Cambridge Circus], [[Transport for London]] (BBC website) {{Coord|51|30|47|N|0|07|45|W|region:GB_type:landmark|display=title}} [[Category:Streets in Camden]] [[Category:Streets in Westminster]] [[Category:Road junctions in London]] {{London-road-stub}}
